g.text: • Phase A leads Phase B by 120°
• Phase B leads Phase C by 120°
• Phase A leads Phase C by 120°
• Phase C leads Phase B by 120°

svg.text: P = √3 × VL × IL × cos φ = 3 × VPh × IPh × cos φ
Q = √3 × VL × IL × sin φ, S = √3 × VL × IL
eA = Em sin(ωt), eB = Em sin(ωt - 120°)
eC = Em sin(ωt - 240°), eA + eB + eC = 0
P = √3 VL IL cos φ, Q = √3 VL IL sin φ
S = √3 VL IL, Instantaneous power constant
Negative: A→C→B, Sequence matters for motors
